content.title: Incentive Scheme for MSMEs in Powerloom Sector: Subsidy for State Goods and Services Tax (SGST)
content.department: Department of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises and Textiles
content.beneficiary: Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) in the Powerloom sector
content.details: The scheme 'Subsidy for State Goods and Services Tax (SGST)' is a sub scheme under the 'Incentive Scheme for MSMEs in Powerloom Sector'. It was launched on 1st January, 2022, and shall remain valid up to 31st December, 2024. The objective is to extend fiscal incentives for installation of New age shuttleless Powerlooms by MSMEs in the Textile sector.
benefits: 30% of Net SGST paid for 8 years from the date of commencement of commercial production for Zone B & C
50% of Net SGST paid for 8 years from the date of commencement of commercial production for Zone D & E
Cumulative refund of SGST shall not exceed 75% of Fixed Capital Investment
eligibility: Applicable to all micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) in the powerloom sector
Enterprises must have started production from 01.01.2022 to 31.12.2024
Enterprises should have executed a Four-party agreement with the Directorate of Textiles, Financial institution and Tantuja
Units should be a private sector, cooperative sector and joint sector undertaking
The project should be covered by a detailed feasibility report/project
The project should have been approved and sanctioned by a Central Financial Institution or Commercial Banks or State Financial Institutions
exclusions: Enterprises registered and for which eligibility certificates have been issued/ incentives have been sanctioned and/or disbursed under the respective Incentive Scheme of the State
Enterprises commenced production before 31.12.2021 and applied for incentive under the respective Incentive Scheme of the State within the stipulated date
content.application_process: Offline. An eligible enterprise shall apply in prescribed format in FORM-E to the Commissioner of Commercial Taxes, West Bengal.
documents_required: A copy of the Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association authenticated by the Registrar of Companies/ partnership deed
A statement on the name and address of the Directors /Partners /Owners of the enterprise
A copy of loan sanctions letter and disbursement letter issued by financial institutions/ banks
A copy of the audited balance sheet for the last 2 years
Existing manufacturing activities in West Bengal stating items, annual approved capacity, annual production during the last three years
Copy of the land deed (wherever applicable)
Copy of mutation & conversion certificate of land/building
Copy of valid consent to operate certificate from the WBPCB
Copy of first electricity bill (wherever applicable)
Copy of acknowledgement of Udyam Registration
Copy of SC / ST certificate wherever applicable
Copy of other statutory licenses/certificates, if necessary
Self declaration as per para 7.1(vi) of the Official Scheme Guidelines
A receipt copy of the application submitted to the Commissioner, Commercial Tax, West Bengal on SGST

faqs.question: What areas are classified under 'Zone A' for the purpose of determining incentives?
faqs.answer: 'Zone A' includes Kolkata Municipal Corporation Area, All municipal areas of North 24- Parganas, All municipal areas of South 24-Parganas, All municipal Corporation and municipal areas of Howrah.

faqs.question: Which districts fall under 'Zone B' for incentive classification?
faqs.answer: 'Zone B' comprises Districts of Hooghly, North 24 Parganas (excluding municipal areas and Sundarban areas), South 24 Parganas (excluding municipal areas and Sundarban areas), Howrah (excluding corporation and municipal areas), Siliguri Municipal Corporation, Municipal Corporations / Municipal Areas of Paschim Medinipur, Purba Medinipur, Purba Bardhaman, Paschim Bardhaman and Nadia.

faqs.question: What is the primary eligibility criteria for incentives under the 'Incentive Scheme for MSMEs in Powerloom Sector'?
faqs.answer: The scheme shall generally be applicable to all micro, small and medium enterprises in the powerloom sector which have started production on or after 1st day of January, 2022 and have executed a Four-party agreement.
